treatments.title: Exercise Therapy
treatments.description: Therapeutic exercises prescribed to restore normal function, reduce pain, and prevent disability. Programs are tailored to individual needs and may include stretching, strengthening, and aerobic activities.

treatments.title: Manual Therapy
treatments.description: Hands-on techniques used to treat musculoskeletal pain and dysfunction. Includes joint mobilization, manipulation, soft tissue massage, and myofascial release.

treatments.title: Electrotherapy
treatments.description: Use of electrical energy as a therapeutic treatment. Includes modalities such as TENS, ultrasound, and electrical muscle stimulation to reduce pain and promote healing.

treatments.title: Postural Correction
treatments.description: Assessment and treatment of postural imbalances that contribute to pain and dysfunction. Includes ergonomic advice, strengthening of weak muscles, and stretching of tight structures.

treatments.title: Rehabilitation Programs
treatments.description: Comprehensive, individualized programs designed to help patients recover from injury, surgery, or illness. May include multiple treatment modalities and progressive exercise protocols.

treatments.title: Hydrotherapy
treatments.description: Exercise and treatment performed in water. The buoyancy and resistance of water make it ideal for rehabilitation, especially for patients with weight-bearing limitations.

treatments.title: Dry Needling
treatments.description: Technique using thin needles to release trigger points in muscles. Helps reduce pain, improve range of motion, and enhance muscle function.

treatments.title: Balance & Vestibular Training
treatments.description: Exercises designed to improve balance, coordination, and vestibular function. Essential for fall prevention, especially in elderly patients, and for those with dizziness or vertigo.
